summary: The "More Options to Develop and Enhance Remote Nutrition in WIC Act of 2025" (MODERN WIC Act of 2025) amends the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to allow for remote participation in the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC). It permits video or telephone certifications, clarifies requirements for nutritional risk evaluations, and allows for remote benefit issuance (e.g., electronic benefit transfer cards). The bill also requires a report to Congress on the use of remote technologies in WIC, including their impact and best practices.
